Reviews.Content: One word "Disgusting" This is not a hotel, it is a flophouse for the homeless! For those of you considering it, take our advise...don't, you'll regret it!
Reviews.Author: PrimusSierraCity_CA

Reviews.Content: Horrible! Horrible! We stayed here for two nights on the way home from Hawaii. I would have left immediately if I could have. Tiny room. Dirty carpet. Water dripped in the sink all night and the toilet ran. Bargain restaurant attached to the hotel charged $20 for breakfast after a discount. I wouldn't stay here again for free!
Reviews.Author: iowateach

Reviews.Content: Disgusting! We have never had a similar disgusting experience as we had recently in the Touchstone Hotel in San Francisco. After stopping the car, we were molested by a bum requesting money. Check in went ok, elevator was in a miserable condition but our room marked the highlight, a youth hostel being a luxury suite against this. The room looked horrible, the bed covers consisted of two single sheets trying to hide what was within them: a stainy, disgusting piece of cloth calling itself a bed cover. This piece has not seen a cleaner for years... Another pestilent ingredient of our room was the shower curtain: it is difficult to describe the color of the stains on that curtain... yuck! The TV Set was not showing a clear picture, the knobs were broken and the remote did not work, the overall condition of the room was miserable.So we can not recommend this hotel to anyone. It is dirty and the central location does not make up for that. The international staff seemed at least anxious, a simple breakfast was included in the price of USD 99 per night plus tax.
Reviews.Author: Guido_Melita

Reviews.Content: One word - NASTY       Shot 1 looking into the bathroom
Reviews.Author: nlandman

Reviews.Content: Seeping Sewage at the Touchstone We booked through a website. When we arrived, the hotel had no record of our reservation. We should have taken this clue and left quickly...but location convinced us to stay. Big Mistake! If the filthy rooms were not enough to send us packing the sewage seeping through the walls in our bathroom should have sent us on our way. The staff did little to correct the situation other than offer us a more expensive room at our cost! Such a deal. The help was surley, the cost more than we expected and the photo we saw on the internet not representative of the room we ended up with. I agree with the first reviewer: Don't touch the Touchstone with a ten foot pole!
Reviews.Author: ucblondee

Reviews.Content: We love this place My husband and I have stayed at the Touchstone four or five times, for 2-4 days at a time, and love it. It's simple lodging (the Ritz it is not) but it is many things: very clean, friendly, affordable, reliable, comfortable. The beds are platform beds, but we find them to be fine and have always slept well at this hotel. David's Deli is our favorite breakfast  lunch place. That's actually how we found the hotel!
Reviews.Author: ppungens

Reviews.Content: We couldn't get out fast enough. We reserved a room for 4 nights for 2 adults and 2 kids. The hotel boasted confortably equipped rooms with a desk, t.v., cable, etc. and with breakfast next door at David's deli -- with 3 country fresh eggs, etc.The place was downright horrible. The beds were a cross between platform beds and futons that were so hard and the mattresses so thin that it was virtually impossible to get comfortable. The room looked nothing like the picture on the internet -- it was so small you could barely move around. The windows were so old and rickety that they kept none of the street noise out, so if you were lucky enough to fall asleep on the horrible bed, you would be awakened by noise from the street soon thereafter.The price quoted on the internet for 2 adults and 2 kids was $139/night. When we got there they tried to charge us an extra $10 for each kid. We told them that it didn't say there was an extra charge for the kids on their internet site. The receptionist went on the internet but couldn't find the additonal charge listed and still insisted that it was there somewhere. We said, if she couldn't findit how did they expect us to.The delicious breakfast at David's deli was barely edible and I don't know where they got their Equator Estate coffee, but the coffee at McDonalds is far better.We left after the first night and moved to the Park 55. Their on line rate was the same as the Touchstone and the place is truly lovely.Don't torture yourself by staying at the Touchstone. You deserve better.
Reviews.Author: thehighroad

Reviews.Content: unwanted visitors I stayed at the Touchstone on Friday Aug. 17, 2007 and it was one of the most disturbing experiences my girlfriend and I had at any hotel. We were OK with the simple furnishings and small room when we made our reservation because we were only staying one night. When we first entered the room we could see the street from our window and we could hear the noises from the street even though the windows were closed. We also noticed that the smoke alarm was removed from the room. This was not great, but we tolerated it because we needed a place to stay. We fell asleep at about 11 pm that evening.At about 2:45 am Sat. morning we were awakened by voices outside our third floor window. There were two strangers sitting/standing on the fire escape directly outside our window. We also noticed that one of the window handles that secures the window from the inside was missing meaning that these strangers could enter our room at any time. We were frightened.My girlfriend and I got dressed and ran downstairs to notify the person at the front desk of the interruption. He went outside and looked up to the third floor and then ran upstairs to resolve the situation. The intruders were apparently hotel guests as well. After the front desk person spoke to the guests, he told us he would call the police if this happened again. We are grateful for his action and we were able to sleep the remainder of the night.My girlfriend and I informed the front desk person in the morning of the situation emphasizing that there seems to be a real security and safety threat in the hotel. We also appreciated the efforts of the night desk person. But the day person's reply was that she wish she could help but couldn't. She seemed to be saying if you didn't like it here you should just go somewhere else the next time. We left thinking we will not be staying at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: superstar150

Reviews.Content: Not all that bad My wife and I booked a room here because of it's proximity to the Curran theatre. We were going to see Jersey Boys and wanted to spend the night in the city and not have to drive anywhere once we got there. We also didn't want to spend $200 or more for a room for just one night.After we booked our room, we found the reviews posted here, and were a bit nervous about the place. It was too late to cancel and get a refund, so we figured we'd make the best of it. We were pleasantly surprised to find the place was not the horror story that some of the posts here claim. The '50s style decor of the lobby is actually kind of cool. The lady working the registration desk was quite nice. Very helpful about advising places in the neighborhood to have dinner. Our room was small, but not uncomfortably so. Tiny bathroom, typical of buildings from this era. (1920s or earlier?) Tiny television, but that's not what we were there for. The room was acceptably clean. We were on the fourth floor, which has newer carpeting, so this helps. We did have tthe back alley view, but this is the middle of the city. The platform bed with a matress was a bit hard, but then we are used to a nice pillow top bed at home. We've stayed in nicer hotels that had less comfortable beds. We slept OK, until the garbage truck visited the alley below at 6am. The complimentary breakfast was good and the restaurant clean. The coffee they serve is quite good .The bottom line for us is this: It is what it is. Yes it is old. Yes it is small. If you want the Ritz, go stay there and pay the upscale price. If we were to do the same thing again, we would probably check out some other places in the area, but I wouldn't say that we absolutely wouldn't stay here again.If you want a good chuckle, go in the deli and read the owner's description of the hotel printed on the menu. He talks of the pristine clean hallways, (maybe 50 years ago) and the bird's eye maple decor in the rooms (wood grain plastic laminate) I think this guy bought the place 50 years ago, fixed it up, and hasn't done much else since then.The thing is, it wouldn't take much to make this place really neat. Some paint, redeorating, fix up the bathrooms, and maybe some new matresses, and you would have something,Parking tip. You can go right around the corner and the garage there gives a break to people staying in the hotels. Saves you $10 from their valet parking price.
Reviews.Author: denval

Reviews.Content: Bates Motel Avoid this place at all cost. Everything you read about this hotel is true. However, I had to learn about it the hard way. I had the miserable pleasure of staying at the Touchstone for two seemingly endless, sleepless nights. The rooms itself are very small. There is barely any space to do anything in the room. The beds are very bad, not comfortable at all. The tv's are very small, about a 13 inch. The bathrooms are unbelievably small and outdated. There is mold and mildew throughtout the tiny bathroom. And I dont think this place has heard of a thing called water pressure because there is none for the shower stall. The carpets are filthy and the bed linen is very questionable.  The service at the front desk is equally bad. When you arrive there will be no one at the front desk. The receptionist also pulls double duty at the diner next door. They claim they are always booked up but you see very few people coming in and out the hotel. The day I came to check in, she knew exactly who I was. It seemed like I was the only one checking in for that day. The hotel has one elevator serving the entire hotel. The elevator and the halls smell very bad. The two night I stayed, I had to use an oil burner to mask the smell of the hotel. A very unpleasant experience. STAY AWAY,YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: dczone

Reviews.Content: what a disappointment We tried to book the St. Andrews, but they were full and referred us to their other property. We booked without researching...what a mistake! Although, when I look at their website now, I can't believe that we were in the same hotel! The rate was reasonable, and the person who booked our room told us they did have parking available. When we checked in, we were told no, they did not have parking. Public overnight parking costed us $40 per night to park two motorcycles, and we had to hike to get there. We could have stayed in a much nicer hotel for that money.Microscopic room/bathroom was smaller than a cabin on a cruise ship. Bathroom was mildewy on the floors and tiles, and the shower curtain was not wide enough for the stall...either you soaked your roll of toilet paper or created a puddle next to the door.The ancient, hard and lumpy mattress on a platform (no box spring) was next to impossible to sleep on, and I woke up both mornings with a back ache. The view out of our windows (with no screens) was an alleyway and the concrete wall of the building next to us. The street noise was constant all night long. The single electrical outlet made it impossible to charge two cell phones each night...what a pain!The lobby holds only 2 people, and there is no luggage storage except in the unsecured hallway. The lady at the front desk was friendly enough, but her clothes were dirty, and it gave a very bad first impression.We did eat at the attached restaurant, and the food and the server were surprisingly good although the restaurant, like the hotel, was not very clean.
Reviews.Author: loriaah

Reviews.Content: They steal from you Our camera, bag, lenses, and film (worth $900.00) were stolen out of our suitcase from our room. The owner never came over to us to apologize and we had to call the police ourselves. We checked out after one night but the hotel charged us for two nights!! They haven't even responded to my credit card company in regards to the extra nights fee. They have not responded to the California Better Business Bureau letters, to which I have put in a formal complaint as well.
Reviews.Author: doopey

Reviews.Content: Touch(stone) with care!       One of us must have had a suite
Reviews.Author: Kelly_Berkshire

Reviews.Content: The Tombstone is a more appropriate title We experienced a classic BAIT AND SWITCH but in the worst way--other than reading reviews here at tripadvisor, I still can't come up with a way that would have prevented us from staying there, they completely misrepresented everything about the place!Their website was decent looking, and the photos posted there were nice, but really small and grainy. The reservation form was decent, but we ended up making reservations via phone. What enticed us was that it said it was a bed  breakfast hotel and was just a little less than asking price--it looked like a good value; I will never stay there again even if you paid me $1000/night.In our 2 days there, we saw a total of 2 employees--1 was pleasant, the other not so pleasant; neither fit the title of mafioso.The lobby/front desk was a very small place, but decently decorated. We verified that they would keep our bags after we checked out--something they did end up doing, but we returned to find that our bags stayed unsecured out in the lobby all day next to an unattended frontdesk!The picture of a room on the website was nothing like what we stayed in. The towels didn't absorb water, there were small dark hairs all over the bathroom walls. The shower had scum in every corner. The shower curtain was thinner than shrinkwrap, had holes in it, and wasn't big enough for the shower. The choice of water temperature was either ice or scalding; there is no warm or hot--and I do mean burn-you scalding; so much so that you learn very quickly to avoid all metal in the bathroom, lest you leave your skin behind. The bed had a single small and thin queen mattress. The bed cover consisted of stained, semi-clean sheets wrapped around a significantly stained and dirty comforter. There was a 12 inch tv mounted 7 feet in the air above the only furniture in the room--a wall-attached desk/suitcase holder. My 5'4 wife would have barely fit inside the closet; don't try to use it for clothes. There was only a single power outlet in the room. The carpet was so dirty that I didn't want to take off my shoes--much less walk to the bathroom in my bare feet. There was 1 window overlooking the alleyway. There is no air filter/conditioner/heater--there is a thermostat, but I can only guess that it is to provide hope that the hell you are currently is somewhat in your control.Garbage collection just outside in the alley starts at 7am and lasts for 40 minutes. Given the condition of our room, eating at the cafe (David's) was out of the question.The only elevator is very crowded with only 2 people and their luggage. The hallways/stairwells were dark and the carpet was bald in a good number of places.We enjoyed San Francisco, but the Tombstone is a memory I want to forget--I couldn't bring myself to take any pictures as that would only lengthen the memory.
Reviews.Author: RecoveringWorkaholic

Reviews.Content: Awful place. NEVER go there We stayed there for three nights in mid september. Hotel is very filthy: they do not even change the linen between guests!! The receptionist is completely unpolite, and the Big Boss is a mafioso. No words could define how bad our stay there was. I recommend you to absolutely avoid this place.
Reviews.Author: pcastels

Reviews.Content: Skip it It wasn't terrible but there are more than some problems. There are great inconsistencies in the rooms. One in our group had new carpet while others had carpeting ready for the trash. One room had no bedside lamps and another had two. There was no alarm clock and with no one at the desk, a wake up reminder was impossible--unless the noise of the trash trucks count. You'll need glasses to see the tiny television which is mounted high on a wall. While the location is good and the attached restaurant ok, this is a place to stay only when there are no other options. The most redeeming quality was the person at the desk and the waiter in the restaurant who were friendly, cordial and helpful.
Reviews.Author: nfedgal

Reviews.Content: Almost a jail cell My husband and I planned a weekend in the city as a pre-Valentine's celebration. Upon arriving at the hotel, we had to go next door to the deli to check in. What struck us as strange was that as soon as we walked over to the cashier she immediately knew who we were. It was almost as if we were the only ones with reservations that night! Once she gave us our keys and we went upstairs, we were turned off by the odd smells and dark, creepy hallways. We walked into our room and it was so unbelievably small and dirty, that it reminded us of a jail cell. My husband notified me that he made a special request for a view. We looked out the window and on the fire escape directly outside were old coffee cups, and directly below us was a dumpster. Our view was of broken windows looking into a parking garage and a dirty alleyway. We immediately made arrangements to stay at another hotel and returned our keys to the cashier at the deli (since the front desk was unattended). We will never stay here again!!!
Reviews.Author: m8m8s1t8

Reviews.Content: Paid 600.00 to get out My partner and I stayed at this hotel after a trip to Maui (which was fantastic) because of the look of the web site. When we arrived at 11pm all I could say was YICKES! After staying two days in this hotel we could no longer endure so made arrangements to fly home asap.It cost us $300 each in airline fees to make the changes but we felt it was well worth it.I was ignorant of tripadvisor before this vacation but I will always use it from this day forward to plan vacations.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I rather liked this place This place was quite cheap and decent for San Francisco. I'm kind of shocked by the nasty reviews. I went with my boyfriend. We had actually booked a room at Adelaide, which was kind of creepy-looking, but luckily they overbooked themselves, and we got moved here. The bed was stiff but not uncomfortable, and the room was very small but not unclean. We ate breakfast at the diner downstairs, which was pleasant. The staff was nice enough, and they let us keep our bag there all day and it was pretty secure. The location was great, very central, and we were able to get around quickly and easily without a car well into the night. It was everything I would expect from a decent cheap room. I would not say it was the Ritz by any stretch, but a totally acceptable budget hotel.
Reviews.Author: jancola

Reviews.Content: BE WARNED!!!!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!! The front desk manager was rude, mean and irritable. He does not know how to be hospitable and treat guests nicely. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hated this hotel OK, it was cheap, but I have stayed in cheaper places all over the world and none of them have been as dirty as this hotel room. They serve breakfast in the deli next door and the plates, cutlery and glasses were really dirty too. The staff are a little odd (think Lurch from the Adamm's Family) and there is just something sinister about this hotel that you can't put your finger on. I felt uncomfortable for our entire stay. I was so disappointed because it looks so nice on the Internet and from the outside.Also I would just say that if I was going to San Francisco again (which I absolutely loved as a place)I would not want to stay in that part of town. I live in London and have lived in some very dodgy places in London, but I have never felt as uncomfortable as I did around the Touchstone Hotel. The location looks good on paper because you can get to Macys and all the shops v quickly (which we did) but I would stay the other side of Union Square going towards the business district. It just felt nicer over there.
Reviews.Author: JaneLondon

Reviews.Content: Could Not Wait To Leave You cannot judge a book by its cover, that is for certain! The Touchstone has a very cute exterior, and that is about all. We indeed did have to wait for the manager to come over from the deli to check us in, the elevator was rather prompt though... kudos for that. The room we were assigned (queen bed w/ an extra twin) was so tiny. To top things off they tease you with a ceiling fan that does not work, the window unit AC did not cool, and the telephone in our room did not work. Oh, and to top it off the beds were horrible. After speaking with the manager he said there was nothing he could do as the house was full- but to make the best of room we had on a busy night in the city. Neither my partner nor I wanted anything further to do with this place and checked out promptly the next morning witout even trying the complimentary breakfast. I seriously think that I've stayed in hostels back in college that were more hospitable than this place. Budget or not I do not recommed this place to anyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Warning!!! This hotel is AWFULL. A small room is ok, but the rat poison behind the bed was unacceptable. Coming home one night, while waiting for the elevator, I saw a rat running across the floor in the closed diner next door (this is where breakfast is served). The bathroom was ver very small and smelly. The shower was also so small and dirty. Towels where smelly. The view was straight into a brick wall. All in all not a good deal for 80$ a night. Find somewhere else to stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. This was the worst place I have ever stayed, period. The cramped room was cold, the TV didn't work, the hair dryer was broken, it was unclean and the staff, as has been noted, was incredibly rude. What's worse, not only could I hear the people in the next room through the locked common door, but I could SMELL them when they used the bathroom. This place deserves to go out of business, and I am still kicking myself not checking out this site in advance of booking (I go out after one night).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for We made reservations on a Thursday on their website. When we arrived Saturday evening, they did not have record of the reservation. Luckily we printed out our confirmation information and they were still able to accommodate us at the online price of $79 for a Saturday night stay. The valet parking was $21/24 hours, which is reasonable for San Francisco. We stayed in a room with a single queen size bed. Comfort was OK; hard and a couple springs stiffer than others, but we still had no problem falling asleep. The room we got was a corner room so we had windows on two sides of the room, which was nice considering the lighting in the room was a little dull. There was a lamp on each side of the bed, but neither had a lightbulb in them! But there was an overhead light. The carpet was worn and a bit dirty along the edges of the wall where the vaccuum cleaner probably doesn't catch the dirt. We saw a guitar pick under the bed, which I figure should have been seen by the cleaning staff if they even glanced under the bed for cleaning. The bathroom was OK, tiny shower but good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Soap is provided, but not shampoo. Towels seemed nice and clean. Lighting in bathroom was good enough for putting on make-up. Toilet seemed like it wasn't really cleaned. I took a tissue and wiped it down before using and the tissue was dirty (toilet not cleaned like the sanitized note on it would leave you to believe). We were not given a remote control for the TV, but that was not an issue for us since we spent very little time in the room. To address reviewers' comments on getting into the building, we had no trouble. Although the lobby does close at 8pm (or was it 9?), we arrived around 7:30pm. They gave us a key to the room and a key to the outside door, so as long as you bring your keys with you, you shouldn't have any problems. I guess the only downside is the idea of giving away keys in an age when most higher class hotels are using electronic key cards that can't be easily duplicated.We were pleased with the location, although walking down Taylor seemed a bit sketchy. Just keep on the Union Square side when walking around. San Francisco has a huge homeless problem, so you can't really avoid the panhandling. So, in summary, minimalist accommodations and minimally clean. Might stay there again because it is right around the corner from Ruby Skye (dance club we went to), but that is the only reason. Will definitely look around for better choices next time.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never Again! I never thought I would know what staying in a prison cell would be like until my night at this hotel. The front doors are locked at 7 p.m. and, like the earlier reviews stated, the cashier at the deli next door checks you in as there is no one at the front desk. The hallways are depressing enough until you get to the room. It was stark and tiny with bad lighting and absolutely no amenities, no form of heat, an ironing board, but no iron, a television but no controls (or remote) and no hair dryer, even though the slick brochure boasted of all these things and more. After I went back to the deli cashier and told her I needed a hair dryer, one was delivered to the room that evening. The bathroom toilet and sink were new, but you could see through the towels and the shower head (less than one inch in diameter) was not even worth describing. Of all the quaint bargain hotels that San Francisco has to offer, this one should be marked off your list.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never stay at this hotel I am not the type of person to normally complain, but this was the most unpleasant hotel experience my family has ever had. Besides the fact that the website/literature is completely misleading (i.e., we had a broken tv with no remote, lamps with burnt out lightbulbs, no iron, no hairdryer, no coffee maker, etc.) the biggest liability is the man who runs the hotel. There is no TEAM of staff as the literature says, but just one unhappy, rude, bitter individual who should be in any profession besides customer service. I have seriously never encountered anyone as rude in years. The way he yelled at my family when we questioned some charges on the bill, telling us to get out of his hotel was truly unbelievable. Do yourself a favour, stay somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you (don't) pay for... This place is cheap and you get what you pay for. I don't necessarily mean that negatively.My room was postage-stamp sized. The TV was a 13 inch. The service was spotty. And I'm still pestering the management about a charge due to a problem with their online booking form.On the other hand, it's only four or five block walk from the BART. You can take the BART from the airport to the Powell Station for $4.95. The bathroom was newly remodeled.If you want to spend money on fun stuff in San Francisco and just want a place to crash, then this is your place. If you want something nice, then book somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: UofIx3

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't 'touchstone' with a 10' pole! We booked a weekend with the Touchstone (not my first visit to the hotel) as it had always been a nice, inexpensive, clean hotel. This trip, turned my mind around. We tried to check in, and the front desk was abandoned, but when we got our key (from the deli cashier next door) the elevator smelled like urine and our room was tiny, cold and despite our request for an upper floor room we were on the second floor- considering the smell of the elevator, we were grateful. The staff, used to be friendly and helpful, now were as surley as they could be. We ended up changing hotels that afternoon, forfitted one night's charge to get out-- we stayed at the Hotel Monaco across the street, paid twice as much but were happy-- all that we wanted for the weekend. Find anywhere else to stay-- the $ isn't worth ruining your vacation for.
Reviews.Author: DanielRonfeld

Reviews.Content: MOST DEF. NOT A "MUST SEE" or "STAY AT" IN FRISCO I was actually fortunate enough NOT to have the displeasure to stay at this hotel. I arrived at around 10:00AM, room wasn't ready, and the bitter manager told me I would have to come back after 1:00 PM. No effort was made by them to acknowledge my patronage, they wouldn't let me register or allow me to leave my luggage with them. That however proved surely a good thing for when I arrived in the evening to finally check in, I was greeted by a locked door. No staff was available on site, and the for assistance number posted-ala Energizer Bunny-kept going and going and ringing really. I was, in retrospect, luckilly forced to go find another hotel. I guess their idea of being a real hotel at 1/2 the price really means only providing 1/2 the service. Even the online Co. I used to book my trip, realized-after contacting the manager-they weren't surprised by my hapless experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Will never stay there again I stayed at the Touchstone for two weeks in October 2003. The manager was very rude. You had to wait 30 minutes before the manager would come down from his room to help you. The hotel lobby is in darkness by nine pm and you have to use your key to get in. The rooms are very small and you have to use a plastic knife to turn the TV on. Some of the other guests looked like street people and drug pushers. This hotel should be rated -.05 instead of 3.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Well-located, pleasant but austere bargain The Touchstone offers extremely comfortable, very clean but austere rooms in San Francisco's theater district, within a 5 minute walk of the Moscone Convention Center and a 2 minute walk from Union Square and Powell Street BART. It's one block from the Westin Saint Francis at considerably less than one-third the cost. The cable television is small but functional, the bath is a good size for soaking, and the back rooms are quiet (an important point because most San Francisco hotels lack air conditioning). The style of the furniture is Swedish modern and included a useful desk and a real closet. Breakfast is included, although a steady diet of scrambled eggs and hash browns may get boring. The only major downside is the wait for the manager to arrive at the reception desk; when he comes, he is helpful and friendly but that doesn't help when you're in a hurry.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: unpleasant We stayed at this hotel for seven nights in May. We found it to be an unpleasant stay, the rooms were v. small with no air conditioning and no closet, just a small cupboard. The bathroom was small with no window and poor ventilation. The towels and bedding were not changed regularly. A coffee maker was in the room, but no cups, coffee, paper etc. The reception was only available during the day and you had a key to let yourself into the hotel after 11pm. The breakfast was in the cafe / deli next door and was not varied in any shape or form- potato, eggs, toast or bagel and a drink. It was not pleasant and the best thing about it was the location, being very close to Chinatown and Union Square. Not sure why it is marketed as a 3*, should be a 2*, not recommended.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Tolles Preis/Leistungsverh盲ltnis   showReview(23247781, 'full');
Reviews.Author: hhschroe

Reviews.Content: Untere Grenze   showReview(20551800, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Bonne surprise   showReview(20551799, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Nix besonderes aber SEHR teures Valet Parking   showReview(18523387, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Tr猫s bien situ茅   showReview(17445116, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: schmaler Geldbeutel   showReview(16600272, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: W眉rde es wahrscheinlich wieder buchen   showReview(15579116, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: A le m茅rite d'exister et d'锚tre pas cher   showReview(14736941, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Correct et bien situ茅.   showReview(11661796, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
